questions.question: Which is the most commonly used in-situ test for shear strength determination?

explanations.a: Borehole shear in-situ test, which needs drilled boring and uses   plates that load the side boring.
explanations.b: Vane shear test is the most commonly used in-situ test and also in laboratory.
explanations.c: The most commonly used in-situ test is vane shear. Hence the answer can not be both a and b.
explanations.d: The most commonly used in-situ test is vane shear. Hence the answer can not be either a and b.

questions.question: What is the parameter that is noted down after the completion of the vane shear test?

explanations.a: Shear strength is the result obtained from the vane shear experiment.
explanations.b: In vane shear test angle of shear parameter is not used.
explanations.c: In this test vane is inserted to soil and rotated at constant speed until a pointer indicating angle of twist rotates backwards. Then the angle of twist is noted down.
explanations.d: From vane shear test sensitivity can be determined.

questions.question: If the sensitivity of clay lies between 4-8 it is classified as ________ .

explanations.a: For insensitive clay the value of sensitivity is 1.
explanations.b: If the value of sensitivity ranges between 8 - 64 then it is considered as quick clay.
explanations.c: If the value of sensitivity ranges between 4 - 8 then it is considered as very sensitive clay.
explanations.d: Soils generally have sensitivity values of 1 or greater than 1. The sensitivity value less than 1 is considered as non sensitive clay.

questions.question: The minimum depth of penetration of the top of the vane from the top surface of soil is ________ .

explanations.a: The penetration of vane on the top surface of  soil should be minimum. It should not go up to 10cm.
explanations.b: The penetration of the vane on the top surface of  soil should be minimum. It should not go up to 12mm.
explanations.d: The penetration of the vane should be minimum, it should not go deeper into the soil. It should be 10mm.

questions.question: Vane shear test is carried out to find the _________ of clay.

explanations.a: Vane shear test is used to determine the shear strength of soil.
explanations.b: Compressive strength of soil can be determined by Triaxial or Unconfined compression test.
explanations.c: Rigidity of soil is determined by oedometer and direct shear test.
explanations.d: Consolidation of soil can be determined by consolidation test.
